clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Cellular repair strategy for patients with symptomatic cartilage defects of the femoral condyle medial lateral or trochlea caused by trauma or patients who were previously unresponsive to available surgical procedures

contraindications.disease: Unwanted effects from therapy include arthrofibrosis joint adhesions graft overgrowth chondromalacia or chondrosis cartilage injury graft complication meniscal lesion and graft delamination in less than 5 of total patients who underwent treatment
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Autologous cultured chrondrocytes reduce pain and considerably improve function in patients with defected cartilage at femoral joints by producing hyaline like cartilage repair tissue
